intro: Pentanisia prunelloides, commonly known as the purple globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its distinctive purple to reddish-pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it a popular choice for xeriscaping.
